item.title: Random Tips and Tricks
item.description: :thought_balloon: Some useful tips and tricks to make coding a little bit easier - Syntax highlighting in nano MacOS Install Homebrew if not already installed. Then install nano via homebrew brew install nano Open nanorc file nano ~/.nanorc Add the following line include "/usr/local/share/nano/*.nanorc" Refresh your terminal and voila, nano syntax highlighting Linux Open nanorc file nano ~/.nanorc Add the following line include /usr/share/nano/sh.nanorc...

item.title: Building R Shiny Apps
item.description: :sparkles: Workflow to build robust and modular Shiny apps with R golem - Golem cheatsheet

item.title: Setting Up A Workspace
item.description: :computer: Various tools to set up a coding workspace - Code editor | Terminal | Other helpful tools | Hardware specs Here are some of the software I currently use for my everyday coding needs. Code editor Atom – text editor Nv Dark – UI theme Nv Dark – Syntax theme r-exec – send R code to various R consoles...

item.title: Developing An R Package
item.description: :package: Steps to start creating your own Bioconductor package - Interested in building your own R package? Here I’ll outline the steps I took to create my own! Note this will be tailored specifically to creating Bioconductor packages, not CRAN. So just keep that in mind. Useful resources R packages by Hadley Wickham and Jenny Bryan Bioconductor package guidelines biocthis...
